result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Rindal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard J Rindal is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard J Rindal was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Subject to good time and work release.

miscConds.notes: $250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid thru probation.  Failure to pay is a judgment.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

May not possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Must provide DNA sample.
Must follow rules of probation.  
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

CASES:  14CF373, 15CF125, 16CF162, 16TR864, 16TR865, 16TR866 & 16TR867. Defendant Richard J Rindal in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik and attorney Mark Biller.  Defendant Richard J Rindal in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:44 pm.  
14CF373-Count 2-guilty. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
15CF125-Count 2-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  Remaining counts dismissed.

SENTENCE:  
14CF373-I&S 6 mo PCJ, subj to GT & WR concurrent w/ 15CF125, 1 yr probation.  AODA & follow recomm, follow rules of probation.  NO illegal susbstances.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  1 day sentence credit.  

15CF125-I&S 30 day, PCJ, subj to GT & WR, 1 yr probation.  $265.60, DNA sample, $200 surcharge.  $100 DA assmt.  No abusive contact with Amanda Morse.
